website_summaries.verdict: This is the brand's middle-of-the-road model and a good choice for most consumers who have neither a lot of land nor very small yard to cover.
pros: Provides insect-luring protection for up to 1/2 acre of land
Has reasonably-sized catch cage and an easily-managed 3 lb
cons: If you don't need a mid-level model, you may want to consider a Dynatrap with either longer range or more practical design for smaller areas

customer_reviews.title: Great moth catcher but mosquitoes...not so much!
customer_reviews.text: I used this product for a full week, 24/7, in South Florida (tons of mosquitoes). It didn't trap a single one! I sat next to the unit one evening and got eaten alive while not one mosquito went into the trap. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: JTMogie

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely life changing
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely life changing. The no-see-ums made it impossible to sit on our pool deck/patio. I had tried DIY pest control and expensive exterminators and the tiny blood suckers just came right back after a couple days. Be patient. It took about a week for significant improvement and 2-3 weeks of running 24/7 to say I am now bug free. Unfortunately it kills a lot of moths. That’s sad because I really have no bone to pick or axe to grind with the moths but some casualties are necessary to get my pool back. Twice a week I dump the basket into my chicken coop. The girls go crazy!
customer_reviews.author: Jayne M

customer_reviews.title: Can I Give this Six Stars?
customer_reviews.text: I put this up a few days ago - kind of skeptical, but hopeful for some resolution for my NJ monster mosquitos. Holy moly. I cleaned the trap today and there were thousands of mosquitos. The trap was halfway filled and it's only been about five days of use. This is really something. Easy to assemble and clean. Make sure you clean the trap away from anything you don't want to get contaminated. There were definitely some live bugs still flying around when I opened the trap. I was sad to see three ladybugs, but I got them out and onto nearby plants. I am really impressed by this. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: New Jersey Mama

customer_reviews.title: Digusting in the best way!
customer_reviews.text: I was recommended this item from a friend and I couldn't be happier! First I'll say that I live in the Midwest right next to a lake and mosquitoes are HORRENDOUS. In the first 12 hours after setting this up, there was a lump of what looked like dead grass inside the basket. Turns out it was a pile of TONS of dead mosquitoes! Since then, I've been thrilled by this product. The first few days I still felt like we had some mosquitoes in our yard but now it seems to be mostly cleared of them! love this!!
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Woods

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I wanted this bug trap so badly because it didn't use any chemicals so it was super safe to have around children. So that warranted spending almost $100. However, I have had this outside in my yard, turned on, for the past 5 days and there is 2 bugs in it. Literally 2. Do not waste your money. I would return it if I knew how. Also, this model does not have a battery, so you have to have it plugged in 24/7. And therefore near an outlet...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Both were full of bug residue  Gross!!
customer_reviews.text: Unordered 2 both boxes look like they’ve been opened but the contents in one of the boxes was clearly a return. Everything was opened and just dumped in the box. And BOTH items had big residue in the catch basin!! Why are you selling used items??
customer_reviews.author: CK

customer_reviews.title: Must be placed (and plugged in) 20-40 feet from the affected area!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because our backyard had been inundated with tiger mosquitoes. Nowhere does DynaTrap specify that the unit must be placed 20-40 feet from where you want to enjoy. This would mean running an extension cord 40 feet across my backyard... and LEAVING it there. Additionally, when trying to return this item, the "ship to" address provided by the seller did not match UPS address records. It made it very difficult to find the correct shipping address. This, coupled with a 20% restocking fee made me feel very frustrated with DynaTrap. I wish I would have known that the placement was so far away from my house. I would not have purchased this item had I known that.
customer_reviews.author: skinnyptop

customer_reviews.title: Not a single new skeeter bite
customer_reviews.text: We have had ours up for about a week now. Between the backyard chickens and my garden it was always bug city. Since our purchase I have not had a single new bite on me whatsoever. I would recommend this to anyone in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra H.

customer_reviews.title: Great for moths.
customer_reviews.text: we are infested with mosquitoes and i wasn't really impressed at the number of dead mosquitoes. I can run this for several weeks without having to worry about emptying the bucket. If you empty the bucket too soon most of the bugs will fly out since this is a trap and doesn't really kill the bugs until they died of dehydration. If your looking to wipe out the moths in your area this is a pretty good tool for that. I thought the trap was broken until i realized a bettle had wedged itself in the fan. I just whacked the trap on one side the bettle popped out and the fan continued to work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is the first season I have been able to enjoy my backyard without getting eaten alive by bugs
customer_reviews.text: Those little flying critters have vanished from my backyard. This is the first season I have been able to enjoy my backyard without getting eaten alive by bugs! YEA!!
customer_reviews.author: B.J. Reed

customer_reviews.title: Mosquito claims inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend and I were so excited about this product because of all the awesome reviews that it had. Unfortunately it did not work for us at ALL for mosquitoes and we have a tiny garden area that we were trying to clear out. It did however catch everything else that we didn't have a problem with (moths and other flying insects). We wanted to return the trap right away but decided to wait the 42 days recommended. We waited 50 days and still saw no improvement, the mosquitoes are just as bad when we first plugged the trap in. Please do not waste your money on this trap.
customer_reviews.author: Nautia G.

customer_reviews.title: The Jury is still out
customer_reviews.text: We bought a new house last summer on a 1 acre wooded lot. After getting eaten alive in my garage several times, I bought this on a recommendation from a friend. It definitely collects bugs, but we still had a lot of mosquitoes after it had been up for a few weeks. There are a few qualifiers to this: This is designed for a half acre and I have twice that with woods and more woods surrounding, and the mosquitoes in Michigan in late summer 2018 were the worst they'd been in years. I am going to set it up again in the spring and if it seems to be working, get a full acre model for the backyard.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Hubbard

customer_reviews.title: Basic Design flaw
customer_reviews.text: The clearance between the fan blade and the housing is so minimal that is frequently clogs up with dead bug debris and ceases to run. Cleaning is at least an every other day job. The first time this happened it tripped the electrical breaker on my patio. The trap works but maintenance is a major pain which requires some disassembly and scraping.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas H Moore

customer_reviews.title: How sweet it is to be loved by you (Mosquitos)
customer_reviews.text: I bought this with the hopes of mosquito annihilation but instead it catches moths more then anything else. There are couple of visible mosquitos that were splattered to the side of the enclosure from hitting the fan’s blades and that occurred after I clipped a mosquito lure to attract them to the trap. Don’t believe in the traps so called CO2 emitting coat. It didn’t attract any mosquitos prior to the lure. There are still plenty of mosquitos around my yard feasting on my sweet body. I have the trap running for over a week 24/7. Results are not as expected. If only I could attract women like I do with mosquitos.........
customer_reviews.author: Revnyce

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: This keeps the gnats and misquitos away. It's great, we can really enjoy the backyard. It makes a big difference.
customer_reviews.author: Vicky H

customer_reviews.title: Does Not Work AT ALL for the price! :@
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to believe. I just wanted to! Initially would only be a four star rating. It’s just gotta work for that much money! Cool blue light, ergo. Even though “water resistant” I would keep it under plywood/cover overnights, as suggested in a comment. Hmm, 3 stars. After several (squalid summer) months of trying various locations, heights, making my back yard ninja black, etc. to no avail - two stars. I believe this picture of us finally able to enjoy our poolside UNDER the cover of a mosquito net with DynaTrap (DT) next to it is worth 1,000 words - Hence, 1-Star. :/ The DT was able to capture many white moths, two lizards and ants. Hella ants.
customer_reviews.author: AnnaMaria

customer_reviews.title: Does a decent job!
customer_reviews.text: We live in a farming area and therefore are plagued by mosquitoes... literally cant go outside without being swarmed nearly year round, another resident suggested one of these and we have noticed it does catch quite a few. From maybe oct- March (the "slow" season the trap nearly was filled. It also caught a few wasps too and moths... curious to see how it does during our busy season
customer_reviews.author: disneylover427

customer_reviews.title: Totally useless!
customer_reviews.text: Like many other reviewers posted already, this works well with moths but it is totally useless with mosquitoes. I've seen absolutely no change after using it for 6 weeks (and properly positioning it according to instructions provided) and my backyard is still infested with tons of mosquitoes. No mosquitoes found in the trap after 6 weeks...they are simply not attracted by this device.
customer_reviews.author: M.

customer_reviews.title: Works GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: This things really collects the bugs. The first night I had it out, the collection bin was half full. Awesome! Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Schneider

customer_reviews.title: Hard to tell if it's working and a correction
customer_reviews.text: Correction: I had an electrician come in and they determined that the circuit powering this device was faulty. The DynaTrap DID NOT SHORT OUT. It still caught few bugs for the two months it was in use but I have to restate that it was not faulty. My house was faulty. ;-) The trap will power up now. I apologize for the bad intel. Still it was installed in May, operated for two months and caught very few bugs. Provided no obvious benefit. The good pitch in the description sold me. I would take the reviews with a grain if salt if I were you.
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: Catches lots of bugs!
customer_reviews.text: Catches alot of bugs, and looks cool! I love it's glow at night!
customer_reviews.author: Albert B

customer_reviews.title: No more flies
customer_reviews.text: We bought this item because we have four dogs coming in and out of the doggy doors every day -which brought inside sometimes up to 5 flies daily. After some unsuccessful tries placing it at entryways around the house, we settled with placing it by the sink (its darker at night and flies have to drink water I suppose) and it works like a miracle! I might get one fly a week. We sit never annoyed by flies. It also sets out a beautiful blue glow in our kitchen at night :)
customer_reviews.author: Mexicoconut

customer_reviews.title: good bug collector
customer_reviews.text: We hung this in our backyard primarily because of the mosquitoes. It has worked well as the mosquito population has decreased. It has also collected quite an array of insects. It is easy to set up and works well; however, I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 because it's hard to turn on and off by revolving the upper encasement. Lower encasement comes off very easily (watch you don't drop it when attempting to empty the cup of dead bugs). So far, we are pleased with the product.
customer_reviews.author: C. Lee Greenmeadow

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic unbelievable results
customer_reviews.text: I was in doubt but there's always hope the next thing will work. For 17 years we've battled no-see bugs and mosquitos and haven't been able to really enjoy being outside in the evening. I've spent lots of money on other bug machines, yard sprays and body sprays. Nothing really worked. I bought the 1/2 acre Dynatrap and we hung it in the open outdoor cooking/sitting area. Not only isn't anyone getting bites while cooking and eating but it seems to be working for the entire property. Totally silent so you don't have to listen to zap, zap, zap. Everyone in the family is very happy I made this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: A Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I live on the Gulf Coast. Plenty of bugs. I get about a fourth cup of dead bugs in mine each week! Work great
customer_reviews.author: JL

customer_reviews.title: Does this even capture mosquitos?
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure this really works for Mosquitos. I'm capturing moths, ladybugs, leaf hoppers and some kind of flies...but very few mosquitos. There's a little pocket on the cover that holds a round mosquito chemical attractant...I use this and I still don't see a lot of mosquitos in the cup. So, I put it next to a water source...still no mosquitos...at least not in any kind of serious capacity.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Kummel

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't trap mosquitoes.
customer_reviews.text: One of the top rave reviews said the Dynatrap would work with specific mosquito baits. Octenol and lurex. I followed the reviewers directions. No dice. I used the dynatrap on its own, with each of the baits separately and used together. The top review was based in Austin, we are in San Antonio. I gave this thing a month to do its thing. It catches moths. Not a single mosquito. It's an overpriced blue light. Boo.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Great for moths, and my bees, but no mosquitos
customer_reviews.text: Initial review: We live in a small eastern nc town with flooding issues. Mosquitos are terrible but I was excited that this also worked for house flies. I also have honey bees in the yard and it said it was safe. 3.5 weeks in I decided to empty the trap, dissect and take pictures. Mostly moths (which don’t bother me), then honeybees, some beetles, but not one single mosquito. Hoping that the special co2 paint somehow activates soon.
customer_reviews.author: A. Hellams

customer_reviews.title: Where have all the mosquitoes gone?
customer_reviews.text: I placed this under our pine tree in the backyard. Followed instructions regarding height and minimum distance from porch/ hammock area. It has now been three weeks and the mosquitos are under control. Only one bite so far and that was when I was near the Dyna trap checking for operation. We always have just enough of a mosquito population to be very annoying during summer days and evenings outside activities. Other bugs seem to have also dramatically decreased. So far very satisfied with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Rice

customer_reviews.title: Wish I could get a refund!!
customer_reviews.text: I live on Long Island and mosquitos are an issue. I am a mosquito open bar. So when my brother (AZ) and my parents (NC lake house) said it was great I ordered it without a blink of an eye. But I am very DISAPPOINTED. It has been running 24/7 since mid-April and it’s not even a quarter full. And I am still getting eaten alive at dusk. There is no standing water or boggy areas on my 1/2 acre property. Maybe my mosquitos are immune?!?
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Kills beneficial insects
customer_reviews.text: The seller info was correct but I didn’t realize that so many beneficial night pollinators and beetles and evening butterflies were attracted and died. It was very sad. We still had mosquitos flying around. I can’t live with killing all those other bugs to get the mosquitos. Will try something else. If you buy, buy through prime in case you need to return. Big restocking fee and postage!
customer_reviews.author: Steve Score

customer_reviews.title: A mild mosquito reduction
customer_reviews.text: These are well-made bug catchers. Basically just plug and play. Easy to clean out. The one issue is it’s touted as a mosquito catcher when in reality it does more nighttime bugs, moths and beetles. If you have a large mosquito population like we do, this will NOT solve the issue. It WILL help some (we do see a few dead ones in the basket) but has not improved our issue. And we do have 3 around our property. So a bit of improvement at best.
customer_reviews.author: John Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: At first I was super excited. It was about a half inch deep with moths and other bugs after the first few days. Unfortunately it never caught more than that. I moved it to severa other spots in the yard, and still, no seeming change in the mosquito population, nor have I had to empty it even once. Regret buying it for sure. Would have rather put the hundred bucks towards the propane systems I guess.
customer_reviews.author: word

customer_reviews.title: IT WORKS
customer_reviews.text: This deserves 10 stars!! When I empty the trap you can see it works. More importantly no mosquito bites !
customer_reviews.author: RGD Seguin

customer_reviews.title: Mosquito Death Chamber!!!! :-)
customer_reviews.text: So I’m allergic to mosquitos and it’s sucks pretty bad. This thing made a difference after the first 24hrs and it just keeps getting better. I don’t like that I have to have a 50’ extension cord running through my yard but it a trade off I’m willing to make for no insect bites. I spent $500 one summer to have a professional exterminator come out and fog my yard and it didn’t do as well as this has done in just 2-days. The trick is to put it about 40’ from your sitting area where you would like to be and just let it go. It’s been amazing and I now like my backyard. I absolutely love this product.
customer_reviews.author: clickinaround

customer_reviews.title: Bulb burnt in one week
customer_reviews.text: I had the traditional big zapper. Living on the river though made that unpractical. I didn't hear an occasional zap I heard a constant buzz and smelled fried bugs. So when a friend told me about this product I was really excited. It was easy to set up and I checked it once after it was running and it was catching quite a few bugs but after about a week the bulb went out. Now I don't know if I should return it while I still can or should try and get a new bulb. For $100 I expected it to last longer than a week. During that week though I did notice less mosquitos
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Has not performed as described.
customer_reviews.text: Update - this has on 24/7 for almost 2 months, placed in 4 different locations and I still get bit. I was outside for less than 20 min at 7am and I had multiple mosquito bites. Don't wait your money. I have had this on 24/7 for over a week and I am still getting bit by mosquitoes! I haven't even noticed a decrease in mosquitoes. I was bit 6 times in 30 minutes! We only live on 1/4 of an acre, so it should have taken care of the mosquitos. I had high hope for this, but it has not performed as described.
customer_reviews.author: Bella

customer_reviews.title: dont do it...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased it last in the summer last year so I really didn't get to see it work that long. However I live in a wooded area and as yet I have not had to empty the basket once and its been on for almost two months. Personally if it sound to good to be true, well you know the rest. Would not recommend it to any one. Lot of hype and NO action...
customer_reviews.author: proff

customer_reviews.title: Appears to work so far
customer_reviews.text: We have used this trap for 5 weeks so far. The insect trap is quiet and captures a good number of night bugs. Mostly moths. It's hard to say if there are that many mosquitoes in the trap as the desiccated remains are tiny. We have not had a bad mosquito season as it was also quite dry in the northeast this summer. You do need an AC outlet nearby and something to hang it from. It seems to do what the company claims and it is easy to maintain.
customer_reviews.author: eDave93

customer_reviews.title: I still saw one or two every once in a while but nothing like what we had before
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my back yard during the Texas summer. I noticed more mosquitoes than normal this year while we were swimming in the back yard. A week after putting it up per the instructions, I saw a major reduction in the mosquitoes bothering us. I still saw one or two every once in a while but nothing like what we had before. They would be all over our ankles and flying around our faces. Now we can actually go out and enjoy the yard.
customer_reviews.author: 96blackstang

customer_reviews.title: One Month and No Results 🕷🦗🦗🦗🦗🦗🦗---UPDATE Still a piece of JUNK---Eaten alive by mosquitos!
customer_reviews.text: So far I have had this running day in a night in a very small garden for one month. I was excited when I saw "stuff" inside, but I still couldn't relax on the patio without being constantly pestered by mosquitos and flies. That "stuff" turned out to be tiny white moths that I never saw before and had never bothered me (poor little guys). Not ONE mosquito or fly has ever been caught! I will update this if anything changes but so far this is one big ZERO.
customer_reviews.author: Chatturanga

customer_reviews.title: Not as great as I originally thought
customer_reviews.text: Update- I contacted the company they are sending men a new one a new one. I will update star rating a when a see if this one works better. This was delivered early June and before mid August the fan is not working. I emptied it, cleaned it the best I can and it’s still not working. The first time I noticed it was a month after purchase, but we had been away for a couple weeks. Once I cleaned it the fan started right back up, This time it started, but ran for less than 12 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well Made But DOESN’T Catch Mosquitoes!
customer_reviews.text: Well made, easy to use, very nice device. I wish it caught mosquitoes! Unfortunately after two weeks NOT ONE mosquito went into the trap. And there were, and still are, an abundance of hungry mosquitoes. But not in the trap! Being sent back. Disappointing!
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Not a good product
customer_reviews.text: We've had this for 2 months. Moths and June bugs are a out all this thing traps. I rarely write a negative review, but this is not worth the money. I'd like to return the item for a full refund, however after this long I dont think they'll take it back
customer_reviews.author: Randolph Duke

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work for mosquitos
customer_reviews.text: Like every other bug lamp I've tried, this doesn't work at all for mosquitos, only for killing harmless insects. I've left this outside my house for several weeks and it is filled with hundreds of moths, some beetles, and zero mosquitos. We still have plenty of Asian Tiger mosquitos outside just waiting for us to come out so they can bite us. Mosquitos aren't attracted to light and the supposed CO2 this lamp is supposed to emit looks to be a fantasy.
customer_reviews.author: Spock

customer_reviews.title: Works just Grand!
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. Instantly I felt a difference, like three days. Now it’s been up 12july19till today only 25july19. Emptied twice Full of bugs I put sevin dust in the bottom to quicken their expiration, not again it didn’t really help. I will order a new bulb in the fall. I have 1/3 acre bought a 1/2 acre machine. It will be fabulous during August by then the cycles will be all interrupted. I still have lightening bugs so they are not harmed. I am thrilled. I use cedarcide on my lawn, no harm to anything four legged. Still have lovely critters running around. This whole idea is great.
customer_reviews.author: Susan T

customer_reviews.title: great product. And I live in MS where the bugs are bad.
customer_reviews.text: So in about 3 weeks it pulled in a good pound and a half of bugs. It keeps me safe while sitting outside. Honestly thinking about buying a second for more coverage. Bought one for my buddy as a house warming gift. Only down side is it pulls in so many bugs when you go to empty it some may still be alive. I suggest unplugging it after encasing it in a trash bag and let the rest dye over a day or two. Then clean it and hang it back.
customer_reviews.author: CHRONO

customer_reviews.title: Gets rid of all your mosquito problems quick!
customer_reviews.text: This thing works waaay better than we ever imagined. We have a huge yard that’s heavily wooded and no matter how much we sprayed the mosquitos were still biting us like crazy. We put this out near our back deck in a shaded spot and within 4 hours it was filling up with mosquitos and moths. We’ve left it running for 2 days now and haven’t gotten bit once while hanging out on the deck. It’s amazing and I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Simona

customer_reviews.title: Was not expecting much but was still disappointed
customer_reviews.text: After reading reviews I did not have high hopes, but was willing to take the risk. After a month it had not caught any mosquitos, so I put a cartridge in the bottom of the trap in the hopes of drawing mosquitos in. The next time I cleaned the trap there were a few mosquitos (half-hearted yeah!). Now after about two months the fan has stopped working, which now makes the device useless since their is nothing keeping the bugs/mosquitos inside the trap.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: does not catch mosquitoes
customer_reviews.text: This device had no effect on the mosquitoes in the my back yard (Saint Louis area). I hung it in an overgrown shady area, 5 feet off the ground, and tried both octanol and Lurex3 baits. Each time I go out to empty it, there are more mosquitoes landing on me than are caught in this "trap". It is very good at killing moths, which is not what I am interested in.
customer_reviews.author: Gravity Wave

customer_reviews.title: Not one mosquito - Didn't work at all
customer_reviews.text: I had huge hopes for this mosquito 'miracle worker'. I have a LOT of mosquitos in the summer. This did not work at all - not one mosquito got in the trap (small moths), and mosquitoes still swarmed everywhere when we went outside. The one positive, is that it looks nice - it's a pretty 'garden latern' - but unfortunately that's all it worked as for me. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Abm2485

customer_reviews.title: I think the light attracts mostly moths. I mostly ...
customer_reviews.text: I think the light attracts mostly moths. I mostly see other insects than mosquitoes. It has not solved our mosquitoes problem after 7 weeks of using it. I did what others had suggested: keeping away from other light sources and the area you're in. Mosquitoes still drawn towards people instead of the light of the trap.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Curnutte

customer_reviews.title: OMG...I have my yard back!
customer_reviews.text: This is quiet and a soft night light. This works. I dump out a softball sized ball of dead mosquitos every week. There is a little by-catch of moths, but I'm ok with that. I was outside for hours well after dark with no spray on and I got 1 mosquito bite on my ankle. Amazing. I am a mosquito magnet. (pun intended). One $15 bulb a summer. Not bad. Being used in NH.
customer_reviews.author: Amesbury2013

customer_reviews.title: My chickens loved this insect killer but the fan quit working.
customer_reviews.text: This is the ultimate mosquito killer! It emits CO2 to attract all the bugs, uses the fan to suck them in when they get close, and then kills them! We used it for three days straight and there were a ton of bugs. I emptied it out and my chickens went crazy for their extra protein. Unfortunately, the fan stopped working and only after three days! We have returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron and Samantha Burns

customer_reviews.title: Does not trap mosquitoes.
customer_reviews.text: Just a warning. I used this last year, moved to a different location and have been using again this year. Have never found one mosquito caught in it. If it’s moths you’re after, it catches scads of small ones. But if, like me, you are only after mosquitoes, this may not be the way to go. I do hear that if you use lures, which some say come with the trap (mine did not include any) it works better. I'm looking for some now to try. Very disappointing, so far. Not doing the job it was purchased for at all.
customer_reviews.author: SGG

customer_reviews.title: Catches a lot of bugs but few mosquitoes
customer_reviews.text: I catch many little moths and various flying bugs but as I look through the pile of dead creatures, I find very very few mosquitoes. I have had this up for over a month now and no increase in mosquito catching. I live in Florida where the average is very small and like to bite around the ankles and legs. I'll give it a few more weeks before I consider returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Ronobono

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt' trap mosquitos
customer_reviews.text: I have had my Dynatrap for several months and while it does catch bugs, it is not catching what we bought this for! I have a lot of mosquitos that like to gather at my front door area. This device has done absolutely nothing to solve our problem!!! Therefore it was really a waste of $100 on our end. Hope this helps others!
customer_reviews.author: Keith Kimsey

customer_reviews.title: One Awesome Invention
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these. One on the front porch and one on the back patio. We have a very bug-free summer and I am amazed at how many bugs this thing attracts every single day. Very easy to maintain. Has a bright blue light at night, but is otherwise nearly silent. No zapping, it just attracts the bugs and keeps them in the trap with a small fan. Does not attract or catch bees because they are too strong for the fan. If you have a knat or fly problem, this will take care of that quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Richard B

customer_reviews.title: Mosquito Killer
customer_reviews.text: Trap was delivered on a Saturday. I hung from a tree branch using chain (included) - - trap sits approx. 5 feet off ground. This baby has been running 24/7 (away from competing light sources) for 4 days now. I emptied today and the trap was half full. Amazing!!! Tough to tell if the trap has made a noticeable difference this early, but this beauty is responsible for the demise of hundreds of Minnesota’s finest mosquitoes and other flying critters. Highly recommended. I’m not a paid sponser. Just a regular dude who has been battling MN mosquitoes for decades.
customer_reviews.author: TVH

customer_reviews.title: Works great has to be cleaned frequently
customer_reviews.text: My dyatrap is great so many bugs i had to empty every three days. The only downside is cleaning, the plastic fan blades get clogged with insect parts and stop. Metal fan blade would lesson this problem or stronger mower. Both of my dynatrap have same problem. Would be ordering a larger unit if it did not have same problem.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gave it some some friends with a 1/4 acre back ...
customer_reviews.text: Gave it some some friends with a 1/4 acre back yard and they were able to sit outside for the first time in years without being bothered by insects !!
customer_reviews.author: Richard Singer

customer_reviews.title: Captures all kinds of insects
customer_reviews.text: Bought this after a friend recommend it, and have been impressed with how easy it is to use. The basket untwists from the bottom, and there is always one or two bugs that are not completely "dehydrated" (as they say in the materials). Letting it sit for an hour or so helps to let those special survivors go and then you can empty the tray fairly easy. Needs to be done about weekly at our house.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Roark

customer_reviews.title: Useless. Worthless.
customer_reviews.text: This product advertises that it attracts, catches and kills mosquitoes. I put it up in my house at the beginning of July and took it down half way into November. While my family and I were bitten all through the summer and had to put up with the usual being woken up and then mozzie hunts in the small hours of the morning, this useless machine caught nothing but dust.
customer_reviews.author: Cori Del Rossi

customer_reviews.title: Not the magic bullet
customer_reviews.text: I live in Northern Illinois (so you understand the type of mosquito). My house backs up to a treeline the a pond behin it. So, I have an abundance of mosquito. I really wanted this to be magic. First off, you have to place it in a location where mosquitoes want to live; which is 60 ft away. Directions say 20ft or so and in an area they like to rest- same thing. It catches bugs, but when I've emptied it, I rarely see mosquitoes. Maybe it just doesn't work in Illinois.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Marquez

customer_reviews.title: Caught zero mosquitos.
customer_reviews.text: Not one mosquito caught in our trap. We caught lots of moths and that is pretty much it. We kept it on for weeks hoping to find mosquitos in it but never did. Disappointed in purchase and wish we had returned it. We continue to have lots of mosquitos!
customer_reviews.author: Heather T. Boroughs

customer_reviews.title: I desperately wanted to like this product
customer_reviews.text: I desperately wanted to like this product, but it just didn't work. I read the instructions and followed every single recommendation. Then a few weeks later I re-read them just to make sure. I even waited several months to leave this review since the instructions specifically say it takes weeks, not days for it to make a noticeable difference. Well, after 4 months of being on 24/7, the mosquitos are worse than ever. I live in the Austin area, and we did have a lot of rain from Hurricane Harvey, which is why the mosquitoes are especially bad. But I didn't notice much of a difference even before that over the hot, dry summer.
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Trying to return this items!
customer_reviews.text: This model just doesn't attract flying insects. I cleaned it monthly - then quarterly - and there were so few bugs in it despite the fact my backyard is against a preserve area. I wanted it to attract NoSeeUms but it didn't work at all. I'm still within one year and hoping I can return it. The commercial models of DynaTrap, according to our county's outstanding Mosquito Control Board, are effective. But IMO this one, for backyard use is the pits. VERY hard to clean.
customer_reviews.author: JanK

customer_reviews.title: It just doesn't work it does not catch mosquito
customer_reviews.text: After I received product I plugged it in that day that was around June 1st or so and it's been running ever since there's only one problem it doesn't catch mosquitoes it literally kills thousands of little flying inside but exactly seven mosquitoes in that whole time I live in a mosquito ridden area. I just want to return it and get something that works cuz this does not.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If you live in southwest Florida this does not work for mosquitoes
customer_reviews.text: We’ve literally tried everything out there to help with our horrific mosquito problem and when I saw this I was pretty hopeful. We live by a preserve in south west Florida where mosquitoes are insane. Sad to say we’ve had this for over a month and we’ve seen maybe 3 mosquitoes in this the entire time. It catches moths and Beatles well but does not work for mosquitoes. Save your money if you live in a climate like Florida where it’s wet and mosquitoes are a huge problem.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: NOTICED AN IMPROVEMENT....
customer_reviews.text: Our backyard had so many mosquitoes it made it unpleasant to sit outside once the sun went down. Someone recommended the Dynatrap and we thought we would give it a try. The unit is well made, easy to put together and comes with two extra bulbs, which is nice. Aesthetically, it is a nice addition to the yard, emitting a beautiful bluish glow from the lantern type unit. The directions specify that after running continuously for a few weeks, it would start to affect the breeding cycle of the mosquitoes. We have noticed an improvement in the number of mosquitoes but not an elimination of them. Still a better alternative than having stuff sprayed all over the yard!
customer_reviews.author: trishkabob

customer_reviews.title: Does not work for mosquitoes
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for mosquitoes because they tout it as a mosquito trap. For that purpose, it does not work!! All it catches is moths, and a ton of them. I have it placed as instructed yet no mosquitoes in the trap. It's too bad because this time of year the mosquito population is high! I guess the ole fashioned manual slap method is still my only hope.
customer_reviews.author: Shelves

customer_reviews.title: Fan does not work after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: purchased Half Acre Mosquito Trap ... on Sep. 2017 , after the winter, the light still comes on but the fan does not work anymore. Sent email to stores123 but was told to contact Amazon instead. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: T. nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Has had no effect on mosquitoes
customer_reviews.text: This was honestly a complete waste of money. It collects a ton of moths and stuff, but when I've emptied it, it's about a 100 to 1 moth to mosquito ratio. The mosquitoes are so bad in our yard that you can't even step outside for more that a minute without drowning yourself in repellant. We've had it in constant operation for a couple months now and the mosquitoes are as thick as ever. I'm better off lighting a citronella candle.
customer_reviews.author: TazandSteve

customer_reviews.title: Not exactly what I thought it would do
customer_reviews.text: Does not work on mosquitos... at all! I bought this item because it clams to catch mosquitoes, but sadly after 30 days of use, it only caught a meager 3, but it did catch a lot of other non-harmful bugs so tried to return it for a refund but I waited too long and now I'm stuck with what amounts to a moth catcher! I would not recommend this item for catching mosquitoes!
customer_reviews.author: Raymond

customer_reviews.title: Bulb Issue Poor Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Review #2 1 Star. Changing rating to 1 Star as DynaTrap has not responded to my emails for bulb assistance. Not even an acknowledgement receiving my contact email. Name of brand is appropriate: don't get caught in this DynaTrap Review #1 3 Stars: Had running since day of purchase, May 26, 2020, already the bulb is out!! I'm not sure what expected life of bulb, but certainty > 1 month. I was all set to give 5 star rating for functionality after positive results only to get disappointed with a dead bulb. I don't intend to shell out $40 to get fooled twice
customer_reviews.author: Smegma James

customer_reviews.title: Defective light socket
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 units; 1 had a faulty light socket - the bulb would not light, neither would 1 of the supplied bulbs. There are only 2 electrical components - the light and fan. That 1 should fail right out of the box does not speak well of DynaTrap’s quality control. The other unit worked just fine. I’ve had a DynaTrap for years without any problems. Unfortunately I got a defective unit.
customer_reviews.author: Gil

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up, easy to clean and eliminates bugs
customer_reviews.text: Update July 6,2020. A month in and the results are terrific!!! Not only can I sit on my deck now but can work in my yard without the nuisance of fighting off the biting bugs. Highly recommend this product. Has performed beyond my expectations!!! In only 1 week the no see-um and mosquito populations have been drastically reduced. Placed a unit about 20 ft from my deck and it’s virtually bug free now. We couldn’t sit on the deck after dark a year ago due to the bugs. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: WD

customer_reviews.title: Look good
customer_reviews.text: It is a silent piece of machine. Looks attractive. People have asked how well it works. Unfortunately, I sprayed the house the day after I first put it to work. I can’t tell if it’s the dynatrap working as advertised or if it is the spraying company I hired. On friend di say that even though it says it covers 1/2 acre it doesn’t actually cover that much space, so I plan to buy another for the next summer, just to cover all bases.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Perez

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work at all for us.
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews, I was cautiously optimistic. However, after installing this in our rear yard area, we have to conclude that this Dynatrap is practically useless at attracting and trapping mosquitoes or flies. After several weeks of operation, the trap has mostly captured moths. Mosquitoes and flies fly around it as if they are mocking its presence. It simply does not work as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Frederick E. Wolf Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Dyna"Trash". Did not work!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted this product to work in the worst way. My wife was dying to sit on our new patio furniture but the mosquitoes had taken over. The Dynatrap had absolutely no effect. It caught a few moths, a couple of flys but not one mosquito. NOT ONE!! I left it on outside for a week and was truly disappointed. I went and purchased a $25 zapper and it started killing bugs immediately!
customer_reviews.author: C Grandison

customer_reviews.title: IT DOES WORK
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about this unit as I've never had cool luck with any electronic pest control products in the past. We live close to a river and have a shady patio that is usually a haven for mosquitos. Since having this unit plugged in 24/7 for several days - there have been noticeably less pests around our home. I've emptied the basket a couple of times and it gets pretty full in a week or so, proof that it's working.
customer_reviews.author: JCC

customer_reviews.title: trap for mosquitos
customer_reviews.text: I wanted it for mosquitos and I still have a few around me when I sit out on the patio so I don't know if it is getting them as when I empty it it is mostly moth type bugs but maybe cant see the mosquitos when they are dead, they are so small. so I guess I wish for more in the mosquito trapping than it is doing but it is easy to clean and no assembly so I would do it again hoping as time goes by it will discourage them from coming around or they will get trapped.
customer_reviews.author: kathleen naretty

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS!!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about this product because I'd had a mosquito magnet years ago and it did not work well to cut down on the mosquito population. I put this up and within a month - the number of mosquitos had dropped to just about nothing. I could sit on my porch without being eaten alive. Caveat: It also captures other flying insects like moths, flies, and other un-classified winged insects. Anything that is attracted to the light gets sucked in. But I'm okay with that. Easy to empty, easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Cyngularcyn

customer_reviews.title: 1/2 acre one works better than the 1/4 acre even on my patio
customer_reviews.text: 1/2 acre one works better than the 1/4 acre even on my patio . We were referred to these , and i hope they work with mosquitoes as well as moths. we will see, a lot of friends have purchased these lately. and now the bulb is burned out in 30 days and one day over return policy and now it's on sale grrrrggghhh !!! update , still waiting on bulb to come and hope it's not a knock off/
customer_reviews.author: cayC

customer_reviews.title: Catches bugs- just not Texas skeeters
customer_reviews.text: The device does attract and capture a considerable amount of night flying bugs. However, it did not clear a half acre of mosquitoes as advertised. I wanted it to work and even bought attractant to "increase" my catch- have had it running since June and now it's October. We still need deet to work in our yard or sit on the patio. I think simple chemical fog/spray is the only effective countermeasure.
customer_reviews.author: R. Hubbard

customer_reviews.title: Not as great as I'd hoped.
customer_reviews.text: We have a huge mosquito problem and I had hoped this would help but it didn't. :( Mosquitoes are still more attracted to us than they are to this lamp..
customer_reviews.author: aleblanc

customer_reviews.title: Mosquitoes and other flying pests
customer_reviews.text: This has made a wonderful difference for us. We still use additional coils and peppermint oil to help. I would say maybe 70% less mosquitoes but the other 30% need extra help. Good product. Will add a second one soon to see if it makes it work even better. Our property is reasonably sized with 10,000 foot of yard so it’s got a big job here this year. They have been biting.
customer_reviews.author: Niliwest

customer_reviews.title: works well on moths, does NOT work on mosquitoes.  bulb burned out in 35 days
customer_reviews.text: Product works well on moths, does NOT work on mosquitoes. We noticed a difference on our patio about a week after putting this device up about 20' away. Pay attention to placement instructions. the bulb burned out after 35 days. Amazon has replacement bulbs at $44.99 for two bulbs. Not eligible for Prime delivery, est delivery is 13 days from writing this review.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Great Moth Catcher, Mosquitoes Not So Much
customer_reviews.text: Caught a lot of moths, but very few mosquitoes. I didn't even know that I had a moth problem, however I do have a lot of mosquitoes that the DynaTrap Insect Trap (DT1050-TUN) did very little to abate. So since their product didn't work for me I tried to return it, but the company who sold it wouldn't even acknowledge my request. Amazon was no help what so ever, so I'm stuck with this moth catcher.
customer_reviews.author: J.M

customer_reviews.title: do not waste your money
customer_reviews.text: The lamp looks nice and indeed traps butterflies and moths that are attracted by the mesmerizing blue light. However, this device has zero impact on mosquitoes. The number of bloodsuckers did not plummet or even change by 1% from the diligent use of this lamp for 4 weeks. Of course, they recommend waiting 6 weeks to break the reproduction cycle in the hope that by that time, the return window will be closed. After 4 weeks you should not see any mosquitoes withing 1/2 acre area, but you not only see them, you feel them. Oh well, just waisted my honestly earned $100.
customer_reviews.author: cnn567

customer_reviews.title: Just buy a citronella candle instead...
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to help deter the mosquitoes in our back yard, and for the price, thought it would be amazing. Maybe we got a different breed of mesquites down here in Texas, but I haven’t noticed hardly any difference after installing it. It’s caught more gnats and moths than anything else. For the price, not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: works. Best product ever for mosquitoes
customer_reviews.text: This product is amazing !We had such a bad mosquitoe problem that you couldn't enjoy the back patio for even a few minutes before the mosquitoes attacked..the dyna trap takes 2 weeks to notice a difference but after a month, ALL of the irritating flying bugs and mosquitoes were gone. I bought a 2nd one as a gift. Fyi, keep it running 24/7 during season.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Installed this on our patio 2 weeks ago. When the lamp worked it did collect bugs. All 3 lamps supplied with this blew in less than 2 weeks! No lamp = no bugs. I would of thought with all of the great reviews and hype that this thing would work. Cheap chinese junk, do not buy!
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Hemmings

customer_reviews.title: Captures Months, flying termites and a few other bugs but NOT MOSQUITOES
customer_reviews.text: Left it running day and night for a month. We maybe caught 2 mosquitoes. We waited 6 days too long and missed our return window so now we are stuck with the device. My husband is mad at me for buying it in the first place. I was convinced this thing would be the perfect replacement to mosquito coils burning all over the deck and slathering up with DEET every night to enjoy the evenings. I would not recommend purchasing. If you do...watch the date of the Return Window so you aren't stuck with the silly thing.
customer_reviews.author: E Caroline Fernandes

customer_reviews.title: Catches bugs. But not mosquitoes.
customer_reviews.text: It catches lots of bugs. As those bugs die that attracts ants who eat the dead bugs. I’d be fine with all that. Except that it doesn’t seem to catch mosquitoes. I have a very small back yard. Maybe a few hundred square feet. It’s been running for a little over two months. And we still can’t sit outside because the mosquitoes are so bad. We just get eaten up.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony V. Codispoti

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Don't get me wrong. It catches plenty of bugs. I get a pile the size of my fist every three days. But no mosquitoes. Oh, there might be an occasional mosquito in the trap but mostly it's midges and moths. Midges are annoying but they don't bite and neither do moths. And for some reason I received a tan colored Dynatrap not black as ordered
customer_reviews.author: B. Boyd

customer_reviews.title: Did not catch any mosquito
customer_reviews.text: I live in California, where mosquitos are becoming such a big program for people who love in their yards. I bought two, one for front, and one for backyard. In 3 weeks, these machines caught nothing but moths and other insects. I have not seen a mosquito in these two traps. I was really hoping for something that would really work.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Ngo

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: This bug catcher is a joke. The fan is not strong enough to pull in Bugatti of any size. Been running a month now and has not Evan Accumulated a 1/2 inch of bugs in the maine woods. Do not waste you good money.
customer_reviews.author: Working Wizard

customer_reviews.title: This thing really works
customer_reviews.text: I was unsure If this would actually work, especially for mosquitoes, but we noticed a huge reduction in the insect population in our backyard, especially mosquitos, right away. The photos are what we caught in the first 5 weeks of use. My only complaint is that a month after payment $108 for this on Amazon, our local Costco began offering this same product for $69. With that said, the extended evening hours in the backyard with the family is well worth what I paid for it.
customer_reviews.author: JJPhotoWriter

customer_reviews.title: This does not attract mosquitoes!!!
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews I thought this would be a great purchase. I was wrong. My wife and I just purchased a home this past summer. It has a heavily wooded back yard and an awful mosquito problem. Whenever we go in the backyard we are guaranteed to be swarmed by dozens of mosquitoes. I think people are assuming that all small bugs are mosquitoes. It attracts bugs just not the ones you want to get rid of. I feel really silly that I bought it. It says it gives off CO2 because of the chemical reaction from the light and the metal... Good one, you got me. Don't buy this to get rid of mosquitoes.
customer_reviews.author: BRENT WHITE

product_meta.title: Dynatrap DT1050 Insect Half Acre Mosquito Trap, 3 lbs, black
product_meta.description: Color:blackEach DynaTrap Twist On/Off Mosquito and Insect Trap is simple to use; just twist the trap to turn it on or off and let it do the hard work for you. The trap is capable of protecting your home or property up to ½ acre. The DynaTrap Twist On/Off Mosquito and Insect Trap is the ideal solution to eliminate insects. The UV bulb, carbon dioxide-emitting coating, and the whisper-quiet fan all work together to effectively break the insect breeding cycle and eliminate pesky backyard visitors. To clean, simply twist off the retaining cage and empty. A cleaning brush is included for your convenience.
feature_bullets: Effectively attracts and traps flying insects to provide 3-way protection for your home and property
Easily twist the trap on or off for simple operation and no-touch cleaning
Lightweight and all-weather design allows you to place on nearly any surface or hang from a hook
Delivers up to 1/2 acre of coverage

specifications.Domestic Shipping: This item is available for shipping in the U.S. except for California and to select countries outside the U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars1,916 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
